chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bonita M. Turner was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notified Rachel, ONSO - extension/payment plan reinstated

1:22 p.m. Defendant Bonita M. Turner in court.   Got job November 2, 2016, received first paycheck. Defendant can pay $100 today and $100 per month. Court quashes warrant with $100 payment today and $100 monthly payment due December 1, 2016. Adj. 1:23 p.m.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
11:15 a.m. Defendant Bonita M. Turner in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Bonita M. Turner in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. Defendant enters guilty plea. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Statement
WHS/POP - 3 years
CC/DNA Sample/Supervision Fees
Fine - $2009 plus blood draw surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No intoxicants; no taverns
Jail - 6 months consecutive to sentence received on 4/6/16 with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 9 days
Driver's license revocation - 26 months
IID - 1 year
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA Assessment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given.
Adj. 11:30 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Bonita M. Turner in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Atty Burns - states defendant wishes to waive  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Atty Schiek statement to court.  Atty Burns statement to court  waives any further reading and enters plea of Not Guilty.  Court modifies bond to a $1500.00 Cash Bond  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

3:07 p.m. Defendant Bonita M. Turner in court via video, with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Bonita M. Turner in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Amended Complaint -    In receipt of complaint and Amended Complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 3:11 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

1:22 p.m. Defendant Bonita M. Turner in court, via video in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel, Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig  bond. Adj. 1:24 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
